q: Whatever your mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
h:
“Whatever your mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.
h:
“A man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he is justly entitled.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: To escape from the world means that one's mind is not concerned with the opinions of the world.
h:
“To escape from the world means that one's mind is not concerned with the opinions of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
h:
“Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
h:
“It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.” —
Aristotle

q: Friendship takes time and energy if it's going to work.
h:
“Friendship takes time and energy if it's going to work.” —
Betty White

q: It is better to change an opinion than to persist in a wrong one.
h:
“It is better to change an opinion than to persist in a wrong one.” —
Socrates

q: It always seems impossible until it's done.
h:
“It always seems impossible until it's done.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: There are no accidents... there is only some purpose that we haven't yet understood.
h:
“There are no accidents... there is only some purpose that we haven't yet understood.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.
h:
“Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.” —
Dan Brown

q: Live the moment for the moment.
h:
“Live the moment for the moment.” —
Michael Jordan

q: When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you.
h:
“When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: You may delay, but time will not.
h:
“You may delay, but time will not.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The sun is new each day.
h:
“The sun is new each day.” —
Heraclitus

q: Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great.
h:
“Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
h:
“Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.” —
Charles Dickens

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.
h:
“Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: A Rolling Stone Gathers No Moss.
h:
“A Rolling Stone Gathers No Moss.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
h:
“Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us.
h:
“In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Discontent is the first necessity of progress.
h:
“Discontent is the first necessity of progress.” —
Thomas Edison

q: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
h:
“If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.” —
Criss Jami

q: Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.
h:
“Your only limitations are those you set up in your mind or permit others to set up for you.” —
Og Mandino

q: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
h:
“Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.
h:
“The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
h:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
h:
“At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.” —
Lao Tzu

q: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
h:
“To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Your business is not to 'get somewhere' - it is to be here.
h:
“Your business is not to 'get somewhere' - it is to be here.” —
Dan Millman

q: People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.
h:
“People who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those who are doing it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
h:
“The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.
h:
“Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: There's no next time. It's now or never.
h:
“There's no next time. It's now or never.” —
Celestine Chua

q: There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love.
h:
“There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The older you get the stronger the wind gets - and it's always in your face.
h:
“The older you get the stronger the wind gets - and it's always in your face.” —
Pablo Picasso

q: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
h:
“If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.” —
Henry Ford

q: People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents.
h:
“People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity, no matter how impressive their other talents.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
h:
“You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.
h:
“Remember the entrance to the sanctuary is inside you.” —
Rumi

q: Relax. Nothing is under control.
h:
“Relax. Nothing is under control.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: Intense love does not measure, it just gives.
h:
“Intense love does not measure, it just gives.” —
Mother Teresa

q: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
h:
“The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.” —
Aristotle

q: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.
h:
“How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: The power of human thought grows exponentially with the number of minds that share that thought.
h:
“The power of human thought grows exponentially with the number of minds that share that thought.” —
Dan Brown

q: We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.
h:
“We take care of the future best by taking care of the present now.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Where does a thought go when it's forgotten?
h:
“Where does a thought go when it's forgotten?” —
Sigmund Freud
